item.title: Under threat from Trump, Wall Street banks wager they can fend off credit card price controls
item.description: Five days after Trump's demand to cap credit card rates, bankers and lobbyists told CNBC they have yet to receive any formal or written guidance on th...

item.title: Airlines to save big money on fuel as new weight loss pills gain popularity, Wall Street says
item.description: Jefferies argued that a 10% reduction in average passenger weight could translate into roughly 2% total aircraft weight savings.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves midday: Biogen, Rivian, Bank of America, Airbnb & more
item.description: These are the stocks posting the largest moves in midday trading.

item.title: Citigroup tops estimates on stronger net interest income, smaller loan loss provision
item.description: Under CEO Jane Fraser, Citigroup is in the midst of a restructuring, selling off parts of its overseas operations.

item.title: Sen. Warren says Trump called her to work on credit card interest rate caps
item.description: Republicans on Capitol Hill have lightly thrown cold water on capping credit card interest at 10%.
